website_summaries.verdict: The best burr grinder on the market today — you won't find another model that gives you better results or offers more features.
pros: Has an impressive selection of 60 grind settings
Boasts consistent dosing and easy-to-remove hopper for no-mess use
cons: The coarse setting produces grinds that are somewhat finer than expected

website_summaries.verdict: This stainless-steel conical burr grinder is pricey, but those who make high-quality drip coffee and espresso will appreciate its quality. It's probably not worth it for French press users, though.
pros: Stainless-steel conical burrs reduce grinding heat and protect oils in the beans
Electric timer lets you adjust grind time in increments of .2 seconds
Can grind right into grinds container, gold tone filter basket, portafilter or paper filter
cons: Not as good for French press coffee
Some customers have had difficulty with the machine's clutch and motor system failing

website_summaries.verdict: If individual servings of pour-over or espresso are what you drink, the Breville Smart Grinder Pro might suit your needs, but experienced home baristas are better off buying a kitchen scale and a more affordable manual burr grinder.
pros: The Breville Smart Grinder Pro grinds coffee beans for many beverage styles including espresso, drip, French press, and cold brew
It measures its grounds with repeatable results using a digital timer
It has an attractive stainless steel design, LCD screen, plus cradles that accept espresso portafilters
cons: It's expensive yet doesn't have a scale to confirm the amount of grounds it produces
It's programmable but only for the number of cups or espresso shots you want, not for full pots of drip
You have to continually hold down a button to grind manually

customer_reviews.title: STOP what you’re doing and READ this
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: It started working. Magically and mysteriously. For about two weeks. Then I went to clean it, turned the thing upside down to get the grinds out of the burr, and the driveshaft with the lower burr just fell out. It. Fell. Out. Holy s%#t. I died laughing. Then I died inside. It broke within 30 seconds of me using it. I know you thought you found “the one” but this is isn’t it. They’re selling defective machines.
customer_reviews.author: N. Dobie

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after less then 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for less then 2 months and it is already not working. Ugh! I had my last cheap coffee grinder forever with no issues. I have tried cleaning it watching videos. Now I need to wait until m-f to try to call their care department, which I work m-f so that is tough. I bought a warranty but maybe someone knows how I activate that? I did not receive it but saw I paid for it. Thanks in advance for any advise but I do not recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions: Great build quality, easy set up, and smaller than it looks in pictures. The body is all metal and the controls feel solid. It is better in every way than the Philips Saeco CA6804/47 it replaces, which we use exclusively for drip. Larger capacity, obviously. Much quieter. The ability to grind right into the filter basket makes it cleaner and sooooo much easier. Our gold tone #4 filter basket fits perfectly under the spout and doesn't need to be held while grinding. That convenience alone is worth the price of admission.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good (make that Great)
customer_reviews.text: Once I got my Breville bambino espresso machine I realized to do it right I had to have a good grinder. I looked at YouTube's, saw reviews and chose to get the Breville grinder. I have been very pleased! I have the ability to make the adjustments to my specifications, to grind how long and how coarse or fine. To grind the exact amount for a 2 shot espresso or a one shot espresso. Machine is small compared to some and the price was very acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Designed to break
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute fantastic coffee grinder until about a year of use. Then a part within the machine wears down and it renders all of the exact grinding features useless. Breville does not sell a replacement part to correct this problem, and if you google the 820, 800 or 600 series hundreds of people have posted that this problem exists across all models of this grinder. If you want to drop $200 a year on a grinder this one will be great for you. We bought this as a present multiple times for family before knowing about the issue, soon enough theirs will stop working as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder I ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee grinder! The only down fall I would have to say is the lack of ease on cleaning the burrs. You have to use a can of air to really clean out the coffee which gets all over. I do love the options for grind settings. The grind comes out even and precise. I really notice a difference in the taste of the brewed coffee. The other feature I like is the hopper. I like to rotate between coffees and buying an extra hopper to switch up the coffee is amazing. I would highly recommend anyone to purchase this!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good Grind Lacks Durability for Price
customer_reviews.text: The grinder produces a consistent grind and appears to be repeatable. The unit is a little loud, but not to the point of downgrading the product. The reason for giving the unit 3 stars is its durability. After a couple years the shaft that holds the conical burr came unscrewed inside of the unit. I am fairly certain that there is a way to disassemble the unit, but it does not appear that this is something that was intended to be customer serviceable. Others may not have this issue, but the bottom line is that I expect more life out of premium grinder that get used once a day.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee we've had from a home style grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after a lesser grinder stopped working. I wanted something durable and more reliable than the typical made in china offerings that die after 6 months or a year. The unit is very robust, solid, well designed and properly engineered. The accessories are of equal quality and build. The grind is very uniform with little dust, no larger granules and little waste. As mentioned above, the taste is actually much better. This surprised me as I did not think the quality of grind had that much affect on taste. The price bites a bit for a small countertop appliance. However, it delivers and lives up to the advertisement hype.
customer_reviews.author: Arby

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted two months and quit. It was excellent until the motor started “smelling” like burned wire. I’ve done everything the instructions said to do. I’m calling Amazon for a refund. Horrible. Don’t waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JanieB

customer_reviews.title: Quality Device That May Not Be Worth The High Cost
customer_reviews.text: We bought this device, because it was supposed to deliver a better quality. more controllable grind. So far (two weeks) that has not been the case. Attractive device, but very tall. Controls are not intuitive and some seem to contradict each other. The taste of our coffee did not improve, it got worse. That will likely change over time, as we learn more. We spent a lot more money, for a poorer cup of coffee. Why 4-stars then? Because we assume things will improve as we use the device more.
customer_reviews.author: Evaluator

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache.
customer_reviews.text: Worked maybe two weeks and the sweeper arm broke down. Attempted to fix it...found that parts were not available. I have always bought Breville products and this is the first one that just completely let me down. Shame on you Breville for making such a beautiful product that only works as a door stopper--and for making me buy a Baratza Virtuoso+ to replace it two weeks after buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Bullhorns55

customer_reviews.title: Give it two weeks and it stop grinding.
customer_reviews.text: We have decided to upgrade our coffee grinder from $100 Bodem to $200 Breville. What a despoilment! $100 Bodem served us 7 years with no problem. $200 Breville stopped working after just 2 weeks...not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: USA First

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee but flawed design
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the grind is excellent—we saw an improvement in flavor over our old cheap grinder. But the design is flawed such that beans don’t always flow as they are supposed to, and at least half the time we don’t actually get the amount of grind requested. The machine has no warning system to cause it to stop when it can’t pulk down beans. This results in grinding coffee taking significant time and requiring manual measuring. Not what I expected for a product at this price level.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Marmor

customer_reviews.title: broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. I bought one less than a year ago and its broken. Normal daily use with medium roast beans. It clogged up and instead of stopping itself it stripped the plastic gears inside the gearbox. At 200 dollars I expected it to last a lot longer. This company doesn't sell replacement parts for any of the internal mechanisms outside of burrs. If I was you I would look elsewhere for a grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder
customer_reviews.text: A huge upgrade over prior grinder in making coffee at home ... definitely improved taste and allowed us to reduce the amount of beans used. We use it for drip coffee (Melita #4 filters) and a big plus is that I can measure out the beans and grind directly into the paper filter. I do have to hold the paper filter to do so ... it would have been really nice if it was designed so that I could grind directly into the filter holder and paper filter or 'gold' mesh filter ... but I'm still happy ... We've been using it daily for over 6 months now with no problems
customer_reviews.author: pb

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 6 months. Then broke
customer_reviews.text: It worked really well for 6 months. Then it made some awful racket. At $200+ I expect more durability. Purchased 21 March 2019, broke 26 November 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Uncannily consistent and reliable
customer_reviews.text: The design thinking that went into this product is just suburb. From the magnetic retention of the bottom shelf to the automatic on/off by motioning the portafilter - everything was thought of and executed with good engineering practice and materials. I've used this grinder for three months now - every day several times a day - it is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aceti

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat for the money!
customer_reviews.text: We have a higher end home espresso maker which requires a very fine grind. Burr grinders are hands down the way to go for grinding and even the lower end, high quality grinders are around $700. Coffee shop grinders are $3k - $5k. For around $200 this machine is remarkable. The digital time adjustment and very fine grind ability are perfect the 2-4, double espressos we pull a day. Having the ability to grind directly into the portafilter is genius! We have had the machine for about two months and are still thrilled with it's performance. Assuming it lasts a couple of years with daily use I'll be ecstatic.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year, it’s garbage. Unable to reliably grind coffee even after trying every ring setting on the burr. Motor runs but can’t process beans. Thought we were buying a premium product, we won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Genova

customer_reviews.title: Superior Coffee Grinding!
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance and was absolutely not disappointed!! I purchased it as a Christmas Gift; only posting review now as I wanted to see if would perform/last more than a month. It did and exceeded my expectations. My husband loved it and although it seems pricey its worth EVERY penny. Great but and I definitely makes fine enough ground for Espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Rhino

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is the barista around here. He is very fussy about his coffee. We had another burr grinder that just wasn't working all that well. The grind was inconsistent. Beans that were more oily clogged up the grinder. But the Breville Smart Grinder is a winner. The grind is consistent and it is a quieter appliance. He's very impressed! And that means more coffee for me!
customer_reviews.author: JodyD

customer_reviews.title: A Smart Choice
customer_reviews.text: The grinder has been used for over one and half years. Haven't had any problems with it grinding. It still works as excellent as the first day. I would suggest to uses Grindz to keep the burrs clean of any oily residue and to keep it in tip-top shape. I've use coffee beans that were very oily to dry. The only problem is that really dry beans become statically charged which gets everywhere. The spout to the cup that the coffee grinds into doesn't have a complete seal which would prevent this kickback. So the best solution is to not use overly dry beans so the cleanup becomes crazy difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin D'Amour

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, could not be happier
customer_reviews.text: My house needed a second grinder, and this one is amazing. This is not to be confused with cheap alternatives, but someone who want to control different grinds for different brewing methods. I think it grinder works better than the one built into our current Breville touchscreen brewer. It is a little taller than I expected, and has a short cord, maybe 12” from the rear base of the machine (so you need a close outlet). We have high cabinets with outlets underneath, and the cord cannot reach those outlets. However, it does reach the outlets on side of our counters.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Wow - who knew coffee could TASTE this good?
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart before this. Make that 3 - every one of them would last a couple of years and then die and I kept replacing them. When the most recent one died, I decided it was time to put on my big boy pants and buy something that is better made. I was hoping for something more reliable - but I never guessed how much better the coffee would taste. There is simply no comparison. I simply did not know that a coffee grinder would make such a difference in flavor. I can't say how this grinder will hold up over time, but if it lasts as long as my Breville espresso machine, I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dankers

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I do not yet know about the durability of this unit, however, it does a good job for the cost. I have a naked portafilter and this grinder produces adequately fine and uniform grinds to use it perfectly. It is a vast improvement over every other grinder that I have owned. I love the ability to grind directly into the portafilter. This makes the grinder much cleaner to use than most grind and dump grinders. Also, it is quieter than my previous grinder(s). All-in-all, I recommend this grinder. I will revisit this review in awhile to address durability and cleaning issues.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fairly quiet and adjustable - Good choice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my EXTREMELY loud burr coffee grinder and it has been a treat. the controls allow both grind size as well as grind time customization and is fairly quiet. Very pleased with it. Originally decided to buy this grinder and Breville's Espresso Infusor as separate pieces rather than as a combo unit to simplify maintenance and in case of future service/repair needs. If the Infusor needs work, at least my grinder still works to make pots of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Frankshoes

customer_reviews.title: Very precise grinder, with great built in container and hop
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder, its simple to use, very practical container avoids messes and the hop allows me to change settings or grain without flipping the entire machine. It is loud however, my son gets scared every time I turn it on. The dose is very accurate even though its time based.
customer_reviews.author: JPCV

customer_reviews.title: I’m new to the espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s great. I still need to adjust the timer for a perfect dose but over all the coffee I am getting is off by less than a gram. It’s a little noisy in my opinion, for 200 I was expecting like super quiet but it’s not bad at all. It’s pretty easy to clean, the only thing is that there are some spots where is almost impossible to get the coffee grinds off especially if they are OILY. DO NOT use oily beans with this Grinder. It doesn’t do well. IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke two days after it was not returnable
customer_reviews.text: After just a little over a month of maybe 25 uses, she's a goner. It jammed up with a bean, and now the motor is shot. I took it apart and it's not the impeller, there is no resistance from the motor, so whatever connects the burrs to the motor is toasted. IN A MONTH! Not cool for a device that costed me $200...I also just bought a $800 Breville espresso machine and it's too late to return that as well. Just waiting for that to die on me as well. I guess I'm moving on to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Souder

customer_reviews.title: The perfect coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford Breville, buy it. Their products just flat out work well and are designed with expertise. We are slowly replacing every kitchen appliance with Breville. This grinder is no exception. It makes a perfect grind and is easy to adjust to your brewing style. I continue to be amazed At the uniform coffee grounds that it makes. Plus it doesn’t create the amount of static that some burr grinders produce. It is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: K. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Grinds WAY too finely
customer_reviews.text: Set the internal dial to 10 and the LCD to 30. It still completely chokes my Breville espresso machine, even with the lightest tamp just to flatten the surface of the coffee. This is ridiculous. I tried calling Breville and kept getting this "If you don't want to wait on hold, press 2 and enter your call back number". That was 3 hours ago and still no call back. It's not looking too good right now. The grinder may find its way back to Amazon if I don't hear back in a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love this Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I researched this grinder along with countless others and narrowed it down to two. I decided to buy this one because of all reviews online and I am certainly glad I did. It's sleekness, easy to use total customize able control is what separates this from its competitors. I started grinding my own coffee recently and wow the uniformity of the cut truly makes all the difference! Love the product and brand! :)
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Very fine grind good for espresso but too fine for drip to french press.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking range but it seems to go from medium fine at coursest setting to very very fine at fine setting. Would be good for espresso to turkish press. Too fine for drip to french press. The finer grind for drip may be ok once I figure out how much coffee per cup to set it for. Still a work in progress.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Relatively quiet, great grund
customer_reviews.text: The grinder’s noise level is relatively quiet considering what it could be. It’s definitely quieter than my espresso machine. Finding the right level of grind for your specific machines ability takes some practice, so have a sacrificial bag of coffee beans on hand to find the right grind for your machine. My machine can’t handle the espresso grind level of this grinder so I had to go through several attempts to find the right level for my machine. Other than that, I’d highly recommended this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra black

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value, grind options are endless.
customer_reviews.text: Great value and definitely grinds so fine I’ve chocked my Pavoni several times. The only downside I have so far is that the grind does clump more so than it would on a more expensive machine. Not sure why exactly, just does. I have a little wisk that I use to solve the issue. Also done like the plastic portafilter holders, they are a bit flimsy; but they do the trick and the magnets are a nice feature. Wish list.... add a scale and I’d be in heaven. I’d buy again. In fact buying one as a gift for a friend who needs a better grinder for his Ascasso.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Asher

customer_reviews.title: All adjustments are available for the perfect cup of joe.
customer_reviews.text: It works. This grinder is exactly what I expected. Easy to get an exact amount of properly ground coffee. The timer should be set to the number of seconds needed to give the user the desired weight of coffee. I set the timer to 8.8 seconds to provide about 18 grams of ground coffee. I also use a very course ground setting which works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Leon

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this about a month ago and it is dreamy! If you have a love for gadgets and automation, this is your coffee grinder - newbies to the world of coffee and espresso making will enjoy the no brainer way they have designed the interface to give you exactly what you need from your beans. I spent about five minutes with the manual for set-up and now, with the press of a button, we had the exact amount of ground beans with the exact grind that we want for our morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Christine K

customer_reviews.title: Best Burr Grinder—EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I’ve owned at least 6 different grinders. My first two were blade grinders (hey they were cheap)! Since then several burr grinders including a small hand crank model. All were just OK. But my new Breville grinder is the best, hands down. It’s so fast, intuitive and easy to use. Turns out the best grinds ever! Best of all, there are no fine grinds flying all over the kitchen!!!
customer_reviews.author: StacheCache

customer_reviews.title: Great versatle grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a coffee grinder that could grind course enough for my coffee press a medium grind for my drip machine and be capable of fine espresso grind for when I get a machine. After doing some research and reading dozens of reviews I decided to give this grinder a try. It's a nice grinder, very well made and produces a pretty consistent grind. For the price you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drip, press or expresso - perfect every time!
customer_reviews.text: This Breville Grinder not only met but beat every expectation I ever had when I ordered it. It is simple to use and very versatile in its settings. Some coffee grinders are good for expresso but not drip and others vice versus. This grinder is perfect for either. My son drinks drip coffee and immediately ordered one after trying mine. I drink expresso and it makes perfect grounds for it. By perfect, I mean the grounds for whatever setting you try are just that - uniform and perfect. If you love to grind your coffee, it will be hard to beat this grinder - especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable and Configurable Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is the grinder my work has and we grind coffee with it probably 10+ times a day and it has been going strong for well over a year, so I bought one for my home. The hopper attaches easily, and removes easily and feels sturdy. Some other grinders I have used feel cheap and make me nervous whenever I have to take the hopper off (feel like I might break them). The Breville has a wide range of grind settings, and you can store your favorites as presets. It's very easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: strongly not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Breville grinder since my Breville espresso machine built in grinder went out on my motor gear (last about year). Now this grinder motor start slowly grind or not able to grind, I had use same bean same setting and regularly clean grinder according to owner manual, it only last one year or less. I should check out amazon review closely before purchase which I regret I didn't. I find multiple user experience this situation year before I do. Bad grinder is one issue and customer service is another. Strongly not recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: If your hesitant that this is too technical, don’t be! This is a great grinder, it is very easy to use. We mostly grind espresso and this works great! I can’t believe the difference in how my coffee tastes with a high quality grinder!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Great just a lot of settings
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder is super simple to use and simple. I'd give it the thumbs up for family and friends. My only complaint (and this is just how good it is) is that there are too many settings it seems. There are 60. . . 60 settings. . . It's tricky sometimes to know what will be best. Overall though, it's a great grinder that's easy to clean and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Krista K

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things about design and quality
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe it took me this long to upgrade after my Pavoni burr grinder gave up. This is a quantum leap for nuanced grind adjustments, adjustable timing for the perfect amount, and a magnetic pop out easy-to-clean station. One frustration is that my 52mm portafilter is just enough off that the base won't hold it in place, it falls through so I have to hold it for the whole excruciating 20 seconds of grind time. Ha! Pair with a wooden handle tamper for a high end designer coffee station.
customer_reviews.author: zenBliss

customer_reviews.title: Love this grinder
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, dispenses properly, isn’t very noisy, and works perfectly (had it for just over a week). The timed grind is great. Like the magnetic parts locking features. Only complaint is that the cord is way too short. Had to switch things around on counter to keep it close to outlet. Haven’t had it very long, but if it keeps working like this it is a gem.
customer_reviews.author: A Kalish

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Instead a lots of bad reviews I bought this on risk with 4year protection plan. So far so good. It actually do what it is suppose to do. I will update anything bad happens. It already got stuck at first couple of usage. Because it was not getting the beans at the grinder. You had to shake it to supply those beans again to those burr. But when it grinds, it grinds good
customer_reviews.author: Sumaya

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: 100% satisfaction. After little play with mechanical and digital settings I got really good blend that gives amazing espresso shots on Breville BES840XL! Materials and assembly have really good quality. I'm using it for a couple of months and absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrii Anpilogov

customer_reviews.title: We used to have a blade grinder and we thought it was fine, but we got soooo sick or using a ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a life changer for us. We used to have a blade grinder and we thought it was fine, but we got soooo sick or using a chopstick or something to get all the ground coffee out. We have a Breville Infuser for espresso and an Aeropress for daily coffee, and this has really made a big improvement to not only the coffee, but also the process of making the coffee. It's fun to use and experiment with to get just the right setting for your taste and equipment. Plus, it looks nice on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Alyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Very fine control over grind and time.
customer_reviews.text: We use with a Breville espresso maker and the portafilter fits right into a slot on this grinder. There's a button behind that the portafilter can press, making the whole operation one handed. Also the tray under the grinder comes out for easy cleaning, and is held in with a magnet. Slick.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Rauschenberger

customer_reviews.title: the beans get stuck in the teeth of the grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Grinds well but when we have put in beans that would serve more than six cups, the machine has 'ground' to a halt and stalled. We have had to turn the machine off, take off the cover and pour out the unground beans and then the grinder cleared when turning it on empty. Not something I want to have to continue to do as often as has occurred so far. I am going to ask for a new one and see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: William Newton

customer_reviews.title: Started jamming
customer_reviews.text: Started jamming ~ a month in. The unattended coffee grinder now just needs you to sit next to it like the cheap bladed ones as it may get jammed multiple times a grind.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Cost!
customer_reviews.text: Very user friendly IMO high quality, almost too many options for grind lol I think Breville is one of the top brands out there and I love my espresso machine too. I’d say it might be a touch louder then my previous grinder but nothing too crazy, fairly simple to clean as well & they include a few tools for that. There are some small crevices I bought a plastic toothpik for that works perfectly to get in there. I clean it once a week. I have the $500 Infuser which I also highly recommend. Someday when it dies I’m upgrading to the double boiler $1200 model 😜 I use both daily to make drinks for myself and my husband.
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeBooksJeeps

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only 3 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! It has a design flaw, the drive shaft will unscrew itself from the inner drive mechanism. It is held by lock tight and that its doom to fail at some point. They put the threading in the wrong direction so in stead of constantly tightening the connection it is the drive motor is constantly trying to loosen it with normal use. Other than that I loved it for the short time it worked. There is no fix. You can't re thread it and even if you do and add more lock tight it still will be trying to unscrew itself.
customer_reviews.author: Rider

customer_reviews.title: Not Coarse Enough
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this grinder because it was not capable of grinding coarse enough for french press, which they say it is. Besides that, it is stylish, quick, and pretty quiet.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson who is 23 and he loves it! He uses a moka pot and this grinds the coffee well, the consistency of the grind is excellent and goes a fine as he needs it and you can set it for the amount of coffee needed so there’s no waste and it’s quick. It’s also easy to clean. It’s also compact and doesn’t take up much room on the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Grinder was $199.99. Jams too frequently to make produce enough coffee for 2 cup French press. Extremely noisy, sprays coffee down the back, even with all parts in place carefully. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Donna H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grinder, definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.text: My first real coffee grinder, slot better than the cheap one I used to have with blades, all the different settings are nice
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Loaiza

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am writing a review about a year after I purchased this grinder. Never had a problem. Grinds perfectly for a high quality espresso machine (also Breville).
customer_reviews.author: Rex Koontz

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee grinder. It's so easy to get the amount of coffee grounds right everytime, and it's exceptionally quiet! The only negative thing is that it does grind on the fine side. So unless you experiment with other forums of coffee making besides drip, this grinder is probably overkill.
customer_reviews.author: Justin King

customer_reviews.title: Consistent, fast, and accurate grind
customer_reviews.text: Although our old Breville grinder died after 4 years of about four double shots daily, we love how this grinder dispenses a fast and accurate grind every time. We replaced the old one with this new model and enjoy the new feature where you can adjust the precise seconds of grind so that the portafilter fills exactly, per that particular bean. We've gone with Breville for all of our coffee/espresso needs and have been quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: Breville - always a great value.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I have many Breville items and am always impressed by the engineering and design and the price due to China manufacture. Breville has very high quality control in their Chinese facilities that manufacture their products. Compare at twice the price, still a great value.
customer_reviews.author: MvC3 Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for your espresso machine
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this daily for over a year now and it works great. After some tinkering with grind size and timing for both single and double shots, this now gives me the perfect dose every time. What I like most is how you just push on the holder and it starts grinding saving an additional button to press.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: I made the right choice on this one!
customer_reviews.text: A quality grinder is the key! Any espresso machine will make impressive coffe when the grind is consistent. Very happy with this grinder. Size is perfect for my countertop, fits my portafilter for direct grinding, easy to adjust and operate, feels very professional and looks impressive. Dialed in perfect espresso in a short amount of time. Once set you can keep cranking out perfect shots. Only improvement they could make is lengthening the amount of pause time on the grinder when you pause it to tap down the grinds. You have to be quick to restart and finnish the grinding or it will reset on you and then the amount or weight of your shot will be off.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Geick

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We've put a couple of pounds of beans thru this grinder and it works like a charm. We have a Breville Grind Control coffee maker that is a pain to use because the ground coffee tends to harden in the path from the grinder to the basket and plug things up even when you are very careful about keeping the machine dry. You then get a potful of water instead of coffee and have to dig out the offending hardened coffee plug. Rather than trash the coffee maker, we got the separate grinder and the problem is solved and the coffee maker works great as long as you don't use it for grinding as well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher  Amy

customer_reviews.title: This will change your coffee journey, get it early!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a cheap butt grinder for pour over for the last couple years and have always seen making coffee as a painful task with that grinder, the breville completely changed that, virtually no fines and cleanup is a breeze, not to mention looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warranty?
customer_reviews.text: Liked the grinder so much I purchased one for my mom. Unfortunately have gotten a limon and Breville doesn't answer the phone or let you leave a message. E-mail give computer generated responses. Like Breville but the clock is ticking on my warranty. Way to expensive to only last 2 months of light use. Very dissapointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Warren

customer_reviews.title: It works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a gaggia classic pro and needed a grinder to really do expresso - but I also use my Aeropress several times per week and my old grinder just would not go fine enough. The Breville does both perfectly. its only a month old and I do hope for a long life for the new guy on the block. I hope to update this in about a year. WLS
customer_reviews.author: WLS

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectation
customer_reviews.text: A great grinder at a great price. My 18-year-old grinder gave up the ghost and I just knew I was going to be in for some sticker shock. I found this grinder and am very happy I did. It is much quieter than my last one. The programmable features are sweet, the same dose every time.
customer_reviews.author: JMH

customer_reviews.title: Another great Breville product
customer_reviews.text: Had this grinder for almost 2 years now (purchased in April 2018). Never had any issues with functionality or quality. Continues to grind any roast I use and is very consistent in grind size. Easy to dial in a grind for whatever beans you are using. Love the magnet snaps for both the portafilter holder and the catch tray at the bottom. This is my first real coffee grinder for making espressos at home and I have not found anything to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Ruvim T

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder - happy with it 1 year in
customer_reviews.text: Had it for almost a year now and it's been a great grinder. It can be a bit finicky getting it dialed in but once we got it dialed in we just don't touch it and it's good to go. But for the price it's got a ton of features - everything we need. The noise level seems about average for a grinder - maybe even on the quieter side - but we still installed it inside a cupboard so that it's even quieter when making early morning espresso. We're using it with the Breville Bambino and a non-pressurized portafilter. For the price, it seemed to be the best deal around when I was looked a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rheingans

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have had this one for a while now and I think it is a good purchase. It works and the coffee grounds are even and the coffee taste has improved... I know. I thought the idea that a good grinder could improve the taste was the silliest idea I had ever heard... but it is true...
customer_reviews.author: OldBill

customer_reviews.title: So far I like it more than I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this grinder as I don't like lots of electronics. I was looking at a higher end one but it's new to the market and getting mixed reviews. This grinder is solid with great reviews. I use it for pourover and Turkish coffee. Very tunable and remembers the settings.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Give this to my husband for Christmas. This one operates much quieter than his old coffee grinder. It does not build up static that holds ground d coffee in the basket -- empties cleanly and completely. 12 grind settings gives lots of choices, depending on what he wants to brew. Overall, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wheatheart

customer_reviews.title: Undersized motor
customer_reviews.text: Motor is undersized which is a disappointment from Breville. Compromised on parts, but kept the price high. Good for small jobs, but it may seize or grind inconsistently for finer grinds or longer grind durations. Not thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Doug F.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, grinds right into the espresso pod
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a Cuisinart grinder. The Breville is much quieter, has more control over the size and quantity of the ground, and grinds right into the espresso pod for my espresso machine. The result is a lot less mess, less waste, And a fresher, tastier espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... am looking for a bur grinder to replace our super messy one
customer_reviews.text: I am looking for a bur grinder to replace our super messy one. This container doesn't create any sort of seal and grinders spit out the side. I guess it grinds okay but for the price i would have expected a glass container that creates a seal. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Peter

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one day
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine first day. Second day the grinder was stopped by coffee beans. You can take it apart and take all the beans out, and then the grinder will turn again. Then you put coffee beans in and the grinder stops. Makes a high pitched whine but can't turn the burrs. Trouble shooting guide useless. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Greater burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder, pretty easy to clean for a burr grinder. The controls are easy to use and the output, ground beans, is very consistent and easy to adjust to taste or for your particular brewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great machine - didn't last one week
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional grinder. Unfortunately, I experienced the same issue mentioned in other reviews -- beans jamming in the burrs. I'd have to clean out the beans and restart the grind. This was frustrating, but even with beans dislodged, the grinder began to slow in motor power and eventually stopped all together. This happened in the first week of use. Amazon was great in allowing me to be refunded or get a replacement. Though I loved the grinder when it worked, I simply could not trust it with the price tag so high -- I had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: David E Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder, too fine for French press.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is very nice to use. I can set it up and then get a perfect grind with the push of a button. My biggest downside is that I had to go to the coarsest of coarse settings to grind for French press. Even then the grind is a bit fine for French press.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great for Medium and Fine Grinding but Not Coarse
customer_reviews.text: The automatic dosing works very well as does medium and fine grinding. However, even with the upper burr adjustment, the coffee is not coarse enough for traditional French Press. The lid on the hopper is airtight to keep the beans fresher longer. And the option to save customized settings is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I use it every morning.
customer_reviews.text: Not as quiet as I’d like, but it is highly adjustable for grind size and grind time. Love it. One downside is that the beans don’t feed well on long grinds. If it goes too long, the beans don’t flow well and it runs out of beans in the grinder even though there are beans in the hopper. I have to stand there and tap the top every 10 seconds to keep it going.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried paying this much for a coffee grinder, but am I ever happy I did buy it!! I absolutely love this grinder. I can grind exact amount for my french press and espresso maker, you can fine tune the grind as well. Definitely worth buying. Oh, and it isn't messy or staticky...thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Thankful
customer_reviews.text: This is the answer to all my at home coffee grinding dreams. I've worked in coffee for 6 years & been searching for one that can do it all. One that is programmable. One that can dial my espresso or be adjusted to make a large batch of cold brew. One that's beautiful on the counter. This is it. This is the one. Take care of her & she will take care of you! Treat your beans with respect & buy this gal.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela Mariner

customer_reviews.title: stopped working just out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked well until one day it just stopped grinding. The only way i could get it to grind anything was on the coarsest setting, set at 12 cups, and i might get 3 cups worth of coffee. Took it apart as much as I could and there were no blockages. I attempted to call customer service. Was on hold for 30 minutes, then gave in and left my phone number for a call back, but never received a call. Went to email them my issue, but they do not leave a simple email address, there is a 50 line inquiry form you need to fill out.
customer_reviews.author: Mia C.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. A daily staple.
customer_reviews.text: Use this every day with my coffee. Works perfectly every time. I think my roommate hates me for grinding beans at 8 in the morning every day, but nothing beats freshly ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lettire

customer_reviews.title: It jams all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I had an OLD cuisinart burr grinder that OCCASIONALLY got blocked by coffee grounds. My husband wanted to get me the latest and greatest, so he bought this as a gift. IT JAMS ALL THE TIME! And the motor smells like its burning. I dutifully empty the hopper, take it off, brush everything inside and poke around with a pointed tool and it grinds again for a few more times. I wish I had my old cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Garza

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later . . .
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this grinder for 4 years. I use it every day and have not had a single problem with it. It works great. I have it set for about 2.8 seconds per cup of coffee with a grinding setting of 31. Of course it makes noise....it's a coffee grinder. The noise is not unpleasant. It sounds like the noise from the coffee grinder at Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a dual boiler espresso machine and were looking for a grinder to use in conjunction with that. After alot of research I landed on this machine. Couldn't be happier with it. The grind levels are amazing and it works great. Only drawback for far is when grinding, the grinds stack to close to the backside of the insert, so need to stop half way though and level off to restart.
customer_reviews.author: Chad James Rettke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. !!!
customer_reviews.text: After researching all the burr grinders, I ordered the Breville. I have used the unit for over a month and I still think I made the right choice. It’s quiet, powerful and very well designed. I love that I can easily switch beans by removing the hopper.
customer_reviews.author: george herzberg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old grinder ( Krups) this is much quieter and there's no static to make the grind fly everywhere. Have not had to clean it, can't rate that. Love the ability to adjust grind size and time.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Grinder
customer_reviews.text: We love this grinder. Meets all of our needs from espresso - drip. Very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: William Helgeson

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder at this price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm replacing my previous generation Smart Grinder BCG800XL - This new model is slightly quieter, the hopper has a better seal. I love the pause function, as I like to have my grinds settle in the portafilter basket before I take it out. Also nice, the default settings are ideal for my BES840XL Infuser. I've seen reviews comparing it to much more expensive units. Sure, others have larger burrs, or bigger motors, but at this price point, it's easily the best.
customer_reviews.author: Abel Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Makes high pitch noise when screen is on
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because of the reviews and features. Received one item and it made a high pitch noise while the screen was on. Amazon sent me a replacement that did the same thing. Returned both and bought a Baratza Virtuoso and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Swank

customer_reviews.title: An Ideal Coffee Grinder for My Breakfasts
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality compact coffee grinder for preparing my daily breakfast coffee which is simple in design and compact for my kitchen counter. It greatly simplifies my breakfast coffee preparation every morning. I strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lin

customer_reviews.title: Unlucky!
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after trying to use for the 3rd time! I made sure I cleaned everything from the inside but it's still the same. The screen seems fine, but when I press start it won't grind! It's been 4 days now and I tried everything from unplugging to applying everything in the troubleshoot paper.
customer_reviews.author: saad lafi

customer_reviews.title: Works good when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Owned it for a year and a half before the motor burnt out. It worked great when it was working. It is hard to clean and you do have to clean it farely often. I bought an extended warranty which I would suggest anyone to do. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: works really well, grinds like i need.
customer_reviews.text: so far, works really well. grinds down to very fine if i want it to. convenient, to say the least: electronic dial-in for grain size; nice porta-holder for hands off; easy clean. i recommend it very much as a low-priced burr grinder for espresso.
customer_reviews.author: mikemike

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this unit
customer_reviews.text: after buying two different ones that never came on after plugging them in, I bought this one. It works great. Breville is an outstanding brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger L. Pack

product_meta.title: Breville The Smart Grinder Pro Coffee Bean Grinder, Brushed Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Color:Brushed Stainless SteelBreville's Smart Grinder Pro features Precision Digital Time (adjustable in 0.2 sec increments) to give you Complete control over dose and grind time. The perfect coffee needs a precise amount of freshly ground coffee beans. But adjustments in grind size require different grind times to achieve a consistent dose. Choose among 60 different grind settings to achieve maximum flavor potential to suit your favorite brew. Grind settings allows you to go from the finest Espresso to the coarsest French Press. Further extend the grinding range by tuning the adjustable Upper Burr to either coarser or finer without the use of tools. The Breville Smart Grinder Pro automatically doses the same every time you grind making it easy to achieve a consistent dose.
feature_bullets: Stainless steel conical burrs designed to minimize grinding heat and protect the essential oils in the coffee bean
Precision Electronic Timer allows users to adjust grind time in 0.2 second increments and consistent dose every time
18 ounce coffee bean capacity with locking system for easy removal, storage, and transfer of the bean hopper
Grind directly into portafilter, grinds container, gold tone filter basket or paper filter
Portafilter cradle small 50 54 millimeter; Portafilter cradle large 58 millimeter
Note: Refer user manual before use
60 precise grind settings from the finest Espresso to the coarsest French Press Grind. Voltage: 110 120 Volts. Power: 165 Watts
